title: Cylindrically rotate a matrix by 90 degrees
contentHtml:
Write a program to cylindrically rotate a matrix by 90 degrees

Input  :
1 2 3
4 5 6
7 8 9

Output :
7 4 1
8 5 2
9 6 3

#include <bits/stdc++.h>
using namespace std;
 
#define N 3

void rotate90Clockwise(int arr[N][N])
{
    for (int j = 0; j < N; j++)
    {
        for (int i = N - 1; i >= 0; i--)
            cout << arr[i][j] << " ";
        cout << '\n';
    }
}

int main()
{
    int arr[N][N] = { { 1, 2, 3 },
                      { 4, 5, 6 },
                      { 7, 8, 9 }};
    rotate90Clockwise(arr);
    return 0;
}

using System;
 
class MATRIX
{
static int N = 3;
 
static void rotate90Degrees(int[,] a)
{
 
    for (int i = 0; i < N / 2; i++)
    {
        for (int j = i; j < N - i - 1; j++)
        {

            int temp = a[i, j];
            a[i, j] = a[N - 1 - j, i];
            a[N - 1 - j, i] = a[N - 1 - i, N - 1 - j];
            a[N - 1 - i, N - 1 - j] = a[j, N - 1 - i];
            a[j, N - 1 - i] = temp;
        }
    }
}
 

static void printMatrix(int[,] arr)
{
    for (int i = 0; i < N; i++)
    {
        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++)
        Console.Write( arr[i, j] + " ");
        Console.Write("\n");
    }
}
 

public static void Main ()
    {
    int [,]arr = {{1, 2, 3 },
                  {4, 5, 6 },
                  {7, 8, 9 }};
    rotate90Degrees(arr);
    printMatrix(arr);
}
}

import java.io.*;
 
class Matrix {
    static int N = 3;

    static void rotate90Degrees(int arr[][])
    {
        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++)
        {
            for (int i = N - 1; i >= 0; i--)
                System.out.print(arr[i][j] + " ");
                System.out.print("\n");
        }
    }
    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
        int arr[][] = { { 1, 2, 3 },
                        { 4, 5, 6 },
                        { 7, 8, 9 }} ;
        rotate90Degrees(arr);
    }
}

"use strict";

let N = 3;

function rotate90Clockwise(arr) {
  for (let j = 0; j < N; j++) {
    for (let i = N - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
      process.stdout.write(arr[i][j] + " ");
    }
    console.log();
  }
}

let arr = [
  [1, 1, 1],
  [2, 2, 2],
  [3, 3, 3],
];

console.log("Initial matrix:");
for (let i = 0; i < N; i++) {
  for (let j = 0; j < N; j++) {
    process.stdout.write(arr[i][j] + " ");
  }
  console.log();
}

console.log("\nRotated matrix:");
rotate90Clockwise(arr);

const rotateClockwise = (matrix: number[][]): number[][] => {

    let n = matrix.length;
    for (let i = 0; i < n / 2; i++) {
        for (let j = i; j < n - i - 1; j++) {
            let tmp = matrix[i][j];
            matrix[i][j] = matrix[n - j - 1][i];
            matrix[n - j - 1][i] = matrix[n - i - 1][n - j - 1];
            matrix[n - i - 1][n - j - 1] = matrix[j][n - i - 1];
            matrix[j][n - i - 1] = tmp;
        }
    }
    return matrix;
};

console.log(rotateClockwise([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]]));

N = 3;
  
def rotate90Degrees(arr) :
    global N;
      
    for j in range(N) :
        for i in range(N - 1, -1, -1) :
            print(arr[i][j], end = " ")
        print()
          
arr = [ [ 1, 2, 3],
        [ 4, 5, 6],
        [ 7, 8, 9] ]

rotate90Degrees(arr);

<?php

function rotate90Degrees($array)
{
    $result = array();
    foreach (array_values($array) as $key => $sub_array)
    {
        foreach (array_values($sub_array) as $sub_key => $value)
        {
            if (empty($result[$sub_key]))
            {
                $result[$sub_key] = array($value);
            }
            else
            {
                array_unshift($result[$sub_key], $value);
            }
        }
    }
    return $result;
}

$array = array(
    array(1, 2, 3),
    array(4, 5, 6),
    array(7, 8, 9)
);


print_r(rotate90Degrees($array));

?>
